Also included are aggregate carrying amount of current assets, expected to be realized or consumed within one year (or the operating cycle, if longer), not separately presented in the balance sheet due to materiality considerations.

Long-lived, depreciable flight assets used in the Company's principle business operations, including owned aircraft and on capital lease, as well as capitalized improvements. Amounts are stated at cost.
Long lived assets used in cargo movement and package handling at our cargo sort facilities, including sort equipment, tugs, power units and hydraulic equipment.
Long lived, depreciable assets used in the creation, maintenance and utilization of information systems, including computers, servers, printers, hand held devices, and communication equipment.
Long lived, depreciable assets including tractors, panel trucks, trailers, cars, light duty vans and other delivery vehicles.
Long lived assets such as land, owned buildings including hubs and terminals, buildings under capital leases and capitalized improvements to leased facilities as well as furniture and fixtures.

Sum of the carrying amounts as of the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, sold or consumed after one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer, excluding property, plant and equipment.
